result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Parez

defendant.name: Parez, Christopher J
defendant.address: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Tapia advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

10:44 AM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Mary Caitlin Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
All parties agree this matter be heard by Judge Bugenhagen Jr.
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 21CF1639, 22CF153 and 22CM155. 
Defense does not object 
Court dismisses and reads into Cases 21CF1639, 22CF153 and 22CM155.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/co-defendant (Christopher M Przeracki) listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

08:57 AM Defendant Christopher J Parez in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Attorney Tapia requests this matter be set for a status of preliminary hearing with the defendants other cases before the Trial Court.  Attorney Tapia further states they will likely request a sooner date before the Judge as they have an offer for the defendant to enter DTC Court.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
